Activity: Check emails. Read about new regulations and policies in health informatics.
Review the existing Help Desk ticketing system. Evaluate its suitability for reporting data quality issues. Identify any necessary modifications or enhancements.

Create a clear process for reporting data quality issues through the Help Desk system. Develop a standardized form or template for users to report issues. Include fields for describing the issue, specifying the affected data elements, and providing contact information.

Draft a communication plan to encourage feedback from all users (clinical staff, data entry personnel, etc.) regarding data quality issues. Outline the benefits of reporting issues and the steps involved in the reporting process.
Lunch Break. Listen to a podcast about data science.
Collaborate with @Trainer-1 to develop training materials for users on how to report data quality issues through the Help Desk system. Ensure the materials are clear, concise, and easy to understand.

Contact @Helpdesk-1 and @ITPM-1 to test the data quality issue reporting process through the Help Desk system. Identify any bugs or issues that need to be addressed. TOPIC: Testing Data Quality Reporting Process
Refine the data quality issue reporting process based on the testing results. Update the training materials and communication plan as needed.
Document the established process for reporting data quality issues, including the steps involved, the roles and responsibilities of different stakeholders, and the escalation procedures.
